ngiemboon: Ánɔ̀ɔn ne sẅíŋte Ssé; ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Hannah prayed:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉalʉ̌a páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a te wó wɔ́;
en: There is no one holy like the  Lord.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ńgwá ńkẅiʼi ńgɔɔn meshwóŋè ŋáʼtè;
en: Do not boast so proudly,

ngiemboon: Kyɛ́d palÿɔ́ʼncù pwɔʼɔ́,
en: The bows of the warriors are broken,

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é lɔ́ɔn těen ńzága tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́ ne faʼa fàʼ gie pɔ́ ge faʼ tá gẅiin mmó mpfɛ̌,
en: Those who are full hire themselves out for food,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo nyìŋ kwé,
en: The Lord brings death and gives life;

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gÿo nyìŋ cʉ́ʼʉ mbóŋ, kà ngàŋa mmó wɔ́ɔ,
en: The Lord brings poverty and gives wealth;

ngiemboon: À fó na tsetsáʼ ḿbʉʼʉ nyìŋ gẅie à te metʉ̀ gẅiin,
en: He raises the poor from the dust

ngiemboon: À tÿɔ́ʼte pʉ̀a pé pie é gẅiin pyennɛ́. Táʼ, pafʉ̀ʼnò pú ńdége tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm;
en: He guards the steps   of his faithful ones,  # 2:9 Ps 91:11–12; 1Pt 1:5

ngiemboon: Patejǔʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ lége;
en: Those who oppose the  Lord will be shattered;  ,# 2:10 Ps 2:9

ngiemboon: Elekana la piŋ nzèm né mbʉ̀a yé, á Lámà; ńgʉa na múɔshùm Samîɛ, á gwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ Elîɛ gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ, é faʼa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Elkanah went home to Ramah,   but the boy served the Lord in the presence of the priest Eli.  # 2:11 1Sm 1:28; 2:18; 3:1

ngiemboon: E gubé Elîɛ yembàŋa é laa patezẅɛʼɛ́ wɔ́b; pɔ́ la te ne ńzsé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Eli’s sons were wicked men;   they did not respect the Lord   # 2:12 Jr 2:8; 9:3,6

ngiemboon: Ntí gie pɔɔn panuŋepwɔʼ lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo mvfò láʼ e yɔ̀ɔn: afʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gie mé kɔ́ɔn ne ńnuŋe pwɔʼ, angàŋafàʼ we nùŋepwɔʼ tóo fʉ̀ʼ gie mé ne ńdɔ́ɔn mbab. Ńgẅiin lelúʼ sie é gẅiin mentyɛʼɛ́ méntá á pwó yé,
en: or the priests’ share of the sacrifices from the people. When anyone offered a sacrifice, the priest’s servant would come with a three-pronged meat fork while the meat was boiling

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn shÿɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ twókáŋ, kà tsɛ̀ɛ ngwʉ̌ŋ wɔ́ɔ, kà tsɛ̀ɛ sɔ́ʼ wɔ́ɔ, kà pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lekʉŋ wɔ́ɔ; akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie lelúʼ mentyɛʼɛ́ lɔ̌g ńkẅɛ wɔ́ɔ, anùŋepwɔʼ kẅé. Áa páʼ à lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo na pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ metsèm pie é lɔ́ɔn ńtóo jʉʼó, á Shʉlo.
en: and plunge it into the container, kettle, cauldron, or cooking pot.   The priest would claim for himself whatever the meat fork brought up. This is the way they treated all the Israelites who came there to Shiloh.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔ́ɔn ńzɔɔn ńgwaa tuɔ mefóon, angàŋafàʼ we nùŋepwɔʼ tóo ńgɔɔn mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à gee nuŋe pwɔʼ ngie: ná mbab gie mé ge tuɔ, n náa mbwó nùŋepwɔʼ; à te zẅíŋ ngie ɔ̀ ná mbab gie mé lɔ̌ɔn wɔ́, à ge kẅé pɔ́ mbab mbÿɔ́g.
en: Even before the fat was burned,   the priest’s servant would come and say to the one who was sacrificing, “Give the priest some meat to roast, because he won’t accept boiled meat from you #— #only raw.”

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn púʼu, nyìŋ tsɔ́ʼɔ né ye ngie: Mé zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńtuɔ mefóon; tá ɔ̀ piŋ ńkẅé mbab gie ɔ̀ ne ńkwoŋo. Angàŋafàʼ nùŋepwɔʼ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ngǎŋ, ná né mèŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, tà á té púʼu wɔ́, mbà n ge lɔg tʉ̀ kẅé!»
en: If that person said to him, “The fat must be burned first; then you can take whatever you want for yourself,”   the servant would reply, “No, I insist that you hand it over right now. If you don’t, I’ll take it by force! ”

ngiemboon: Mefʉa we pɔ̀ɔn púɔ ngwàshùm lɔ̌ɔn ńgyɔ́ɔn mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɛʼ, mélàʼmie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn těen ńgÿo mekùʼ na shúm pwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: So the servants’ sin was very severe in the presence of the Lord, because the men treated the Lord’s offering with contempt.

ngiemboon: Samîɛ lɔ̌ɔn ńgwɔ́ ndá Ssé, éfaʼa mbwó yé; à laa múɔ mbàŋa gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ḿmaʼa nzsǒ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sìsyè ḿbáʼ, é gwɔ́ páʼ efɔd la.
en: Samuel served in the Lord’s presence    #— #this mere boy was dressed in the linen ephod.  # 2:18 1Sm 2:28

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ ngùʼ ntsèm, má we téme múɔ meshʉ̀shʉ̀a nzsǒ ńdɔgɔ ńtóo ńnáa né yé, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ ndúm we lɔ́ɔn ḿbʉʉ légʉa ńnuŋe pwɔʼ we ngùʼu láʼ.
en: Each year his mother made him a little robe   and took it to him when she went with her husband to offer the annual sacrifice.  # 2:19 1Sm 1:3,21

ngiemboon: Elîɛ néŋ mbʉ́lè ná Elekana pɔ́ nzwě we, ńgɔɔn ngie: Á póŋ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a cʉate na manzwě wɔɔn ńgíŋe ńná tsɔ́ penkʉ́ mbwó gù, ńdɔg ńkúbe múɔ gẅie Ánɔ̀ɔn la cʉ́me mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! À la gɔɔn tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, Elekana pɔ́ Ánɔ̀ɔn piŋ nzèm né mbʉ̀a pɔ́b.
en: Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife:   “May the Lord give you children by this woman in place of the one she  # 2:20 DSS; MT reads he has given to the Lord.”  # 2:20 1Sm 1:11,22,28 Then they would go home.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gÿo nò mbòŋo ná Ánɔ̀ɔn, á leen ńké shwoŋ; à la gÿo ńgíŋe ńzyé petsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa pétá, ńgÿo pepanzwě mépʉ́a.
en: The Lord paid attention to Hannah’s need,   and she conceived and gave birth to three sons and two daughters. Meanwhile, the boy Samuel grew up in the presence of the Lord.  # 2:21 1Sm 2:26; 3:19–21; Lk 2:40

ngiemboon: Elîɛ la gÿo ńzẅiŋ tɛʼ; ńjúʼ páʼ mé ne shwóŋo na ntí gie penkʉ́ pé kɔ́ɔn ńtɔ́ɔn menò na pa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm; ńgíŋe ńjúʼ páʼ pɔ́ kɔ́ɔn ńnuŋe panzwě pie é kɔ́ɔn faʼa fàʼ yɔ́b á ncwò ntàb mbumté.
en: Now Eli was very old. He heard about everything his sons were doing to all Israel   and how they were sleeping with the women who served at the entrance to the tent of meeting.  # 2:22 Ex 38:8

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mélàʼakɔ́ pi tɔ́ɔn mɔɔn mentí menò? N ne ńjúʼu menò mie pi ka tɔ̌ɔn, á mbwó láʼa ntsèm.
en: He said to them, “Why are you doing these things? I have heard about your evil actions from all these people.

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ mbà penkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn! Meshwóŋè mie n ne ńjúʼu, é te ne ḿboŋo wɔ́, pi ne ńtsóte pʉ̀a mesoŋ léfʉa mánzsè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: No, my sons, the news I hear the Lord’s people spreading is not good.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo nò tepòŋ mbwó wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ, mbà Ssé zɔ ge záʼ ntsaŋ; tá ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo nò tepòŋ mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbà wɔ̌ ge piŋ giŋ kěm? Táʼ, pɔ́ la ké te ncwò tá wɔb júʼ, mélàʼmie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ne faʼa légÿo pɔ́ kwéte.
en: If one person sins against another, God can intercede for him, but if a person sins against the Lord, who can intercede for him? ”   But they would not listen to their father, since the Lord intended to kill them.  # 2:25 Ex 5:2; 14:17–18; Jos 11:18–20

ngiemboon: Múɔshùm Samîɛ la ne ńkẅiʼi ńgúʼu; anò yé piŋe ne ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɛʼ, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: By contrast, the boy Samuel grew in stature and in favor with the Lord and with people.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ Ssé tó ńgyá Elîɛ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Ayɔɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: N da te gÿo pamángʉanjʉʼ pú zsé wɔ́ɔn, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ laa ngwòŋ Egíbtò, ńgwɔ́ na mbwó Falahoŋ wáa?
en: A man of God came to Eli and said to him,   “This is what the Lord says: ‘Didn’t I reveal myself to your forefather’s family  # 2:27 Lit the house of your father when they were in Egypt and belonged to Pharaoh’s palace?  # 2:27 Ex 4:14–16; 12:1,43

ngiemboon: N da tsɔ́ʼɔ mángʉanjʉʼ gù Áloŋ á tsetsɛ̀ɛ ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ésàlayɛ ntsèm, légwɔ́ gie à ge gwɔ́ nùŋepwɔʼ wɔ̀ɔn, páʼ à ge nuŋe pwɔʼ ndùm lenuŋé pwɔʼ sɔ́ɔn, é tuɔ lìi, é piŋ zɛ́te wɔ́ɔn nò. N da piŋ náa tàʼ nzsè na shúm pwɔʼ sie pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ la lɔg ńtó á mbwó yé, mbɔɔ mbwó ngẅɛ̀ ye, é shúm pwɔʼ sɔ́b sie mé tǔɔ tà é pú shÿó.
en: Out of all the tribes of Israel, I chose your house   to be my priests, to offer sacrifices on my altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod in my presence.  # 2:28 Ex 28:1–4 I also gave your forefather’s family all the Israelite food offerings.

ngiemboon: N da tsẅi ngie mé lɔg shúm pwɔʼ tà mbɔɔ shúm se nanǎ, ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼ yɔ́ɔn. Pi piŋe ńdɔgɔ mekwò ńneŋte mélàʼakɔ́? Ɔ̀ ná mekùʼ penkʉ́ pú tà ńcʉa wɔ́ɔn. Mélàʼakɔ́ epúɔ Ésàlayɛ pie ée pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn lɔg shúm pwɔʼ sɔ́ɔn ńtó, pi tyɛ́te mekèm mbab membòŋo, ńdɔg ńnéŋ mbùm gi?
en: Why, then, do all of you despise my sacrifices and offerings that I require at the place of worship?   You have honored your sons more than me,  # 2:29 Mt 10:37 by making yourselves fat with the best part of all of the offerings of my people Israel.’

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ, n da gɔɔn ngie ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù, tà mbɔɔ ye pamángʉanjʉʼ pú ge láʼa gwɔ́ panuŋepwɔʼ pɔ́ɔn fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm. Táʼ, afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, e shʉ̌ashʉa ńgɔɔn ngie á kǔʼ pɛ́ʼɛ̀! Mélàʼmie n ge gÿo ná mekùʼ pʉ̀a pie é ne ńnáa mekùʼ mɔ́ɔn, táʼ ńgʉa na pà gwága wɔ́ɔn, mbà shʉ́ ge gÿo kúu wɔ́b.
en: “Therefore, this is the declaration of the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘I did say that your family and your forefather’s family would walk before me forever.   But now,’ this is the Lord’s declaration, ‘no longer! For those who honor me I will honor,  # 2:30 Ps 50:23 but those who despise me will be disgraced.  # 2:30 1Kg 2:26–27

ngiemboon: Melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ tsoté tà ḿbɔ́ɔnte páʼ n ge kẅé metʉ̀ mú, mbɔɔ metʉ̀ me ngẅɛ̀ ndá tá gù: mezẅìŋe pʉ̀a té láʼ gíŋe gwɔ́ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù wɔ́.
en: Look, the days are coming when I will cut off your strength and the strength of your forefather’s family, so that none in your family will reach old age.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge láʼa cʉ́ʼʉ néŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ cÿɔʼ. Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ge gÿo tɔ́gɔ mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ mboŋó, táʼ, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tsìŋendá jú, mbà pʉ̀a té láʼ tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó tɛʼ wɔ́.
en: You will see distress in the place of worship,   in spite of all that is good in Israel, and no one in your family will ever again reach old age.  # 2:32 Zch 8:4

ngiemboon: N ge láʼ nyé tàʼ nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá jú á jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ mèŋ, à gwɔ́ púʼu, lóŋ gù ffó, ɔ̀ tebe; petsɔ́ pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù e kwéte páʼ pʉ̀a pie é té panuŋepwɔʼ wɔ́.
en: Any man from your family I do not cut off from my altar will bring grief   and sadness to you. All your descendants will die violently.  # 2:33 DSS, LXX read die by the sword of men,# 2:33 Lit die men

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gÿo gyá liŋé gie á ne ńtóo ná Ɔbnîi pɔ́ Fineya, é penkʉ́ pú pembàŋa: Pɔ́b mépʉ́a ge gÿo pú kwé tàʼa lyɛ̌ʼ.
en: This will be the sign that will come to you concerning your two sons Hophni and Phinehas:   both of them will die on the same day.  # 2:34 1Sm 4:11

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo tsɔ́ʼɔ tsɔ̌ kwaʼ nùŋepwɔʼ gẅie aa wɔ̀ɔn; à ge gÿo gÿo mmó gie letʉ́m sɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ zẅìge yɔ́ɔn ne ńkwoŋo. N ge gÿo náa yé ngẅɛ̀ gie e ge júʼ ncwò wɔ́ɔn, à ge láʼa giŋe pɔ́ mvfò nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n da zɔ́ʼ.
en: “ ‘Then I will raise up a faithful priest   for myself. He will do whatever is in my heart and mind. I will establish a lasting dynasty for him,  # 2:35 1Sm 8:3–5; 1Kg 11:38 and he will walk before my anointed one for all time.  # 2:35 1Sm 10:9–10; 12:3; 16:13

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge piŋ láʼ vwɔʼɔ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù, à ge láʼa tóo, é ŋwɔ́ʼɔ nnɛ́ mvfò nuŋepwɔʼ, é gwaa lúɔ yé tàʼa pàga nkáb, mbɔɔ tàʼa tuʼú mbelég, é ne gɔɔn ngie: “Tsétsɔʼ néŋe wɔ́ɔn na tsɔ́ fàʼa panuŋepwɔʼ, tá à cʉa púʼu, n gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ m pfɛ́!”»
en: Anyone who is left in your family will come and bow down to him for a piece of silver or a loaf of bread. He will say: Please appoint me to some priestly office so I can have a piece of bread to eat.’ ”
